hypotheses.title: Suspicious Command Execution via Prompt Injection
hypotheses.action: Identify command executions with unusual parent processes within a 10m window

sigma.yaml:
title: Suspicious Command Execution via Prompt Injection
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: sysmon
  category: process_creation
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 1
      ParentImage|endswith: '\python.exe'
      Image|endswith: '\cmd.exe'
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=sysmon EventID=1 ParentImage="*\python.exe" Image="*\cmd.exe" | stats count by _time, ParentImage, Image | where count >= 2

hypotheses.findings_example: Multiple cmd.exe executions with python.exe as parent within 10 minutes.

methodologies_enriched.name: PowerShell
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution. PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system.(Cit

hypotheses.title: Unusual Privileged Account Usage
hypotheses.action: Monitor for privileged account logins from non-standard devices within 5m

sigma.yaml:
title: Unusual Privileged Account Usage
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
  category: logon
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 4624
      LogonType: 10
      SubjectUserName: 'admin'
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=security EventID=4624 LogonType=10 SubjectUserName="admin" | stats count by _time, SubjectUserName, WorkstationName | where count >= 2

hypotheses.findings_example: Admin account logged in from two different devices within 5 minutes.

methodologies_enriched.name: Domain Accounts
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a domain account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.(Citation: TechNet Credential Theft) Domain

hypotheses.title: Execution of Unknown Scripts from User Directories
hypotheses.action: Identify execution of scripts from user directories that are not on whitelist within a 5m window

sigma.yaml:
title: Execution of Unknown Scripts from User Directories
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: sysmon
  category: process_creation
detection:
    filter:
      EventID: 1
      Image|endswith: '\.ps1'
    condition: filter

splunk.spl: index=sysmon EventID=1 Image="*.ps1" | stats count by _time, User, Image | where count >= 2

hypotheses.findings_example: Two PowerShell scripts executed from user directories not on whitelist within 5 minutes.
